setTransposeX

void setTransposeX(boolean transpose)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                          MicroscopeLockedException
Sets if the x-direction should be transposed. If true, all x-coordinates are replaced by their negative value (x -> -x). This is done automatically for all position related functions.

Parameters:
transpose - True, if the x-direction should be transposed.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MicroscopeLockedException

setTransposeY

void setTransposeY(boolean transpose)
                   throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                          MicroscopeLockedException
Sets if the y-direction should be transposed. If true, all y-coordinates are replaced by their negative value (y -> -y). This is done automatically for all position related functions.

Parameters:
transpose - True, if the y-direction should be transposed.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
MicroscopeLockedException

isTransposeX

boolean isTransposeX()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns if the x-direction is transposed (x -> -x). This function is for information only, the change of the direction is done automatically.

Returns:
True, if the x-direction is transposed.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

isTransposeY

boolean isTransposeY()
                     throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns if the y-direction is transposed (y -> -y). This function is for information only, the change of the direction is done automatically.

Returns:
True, if the y-direction is transposed.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

getUnitMagnifier

double getUnitMagnifier()
                        throws java.rmi.RemoteException
Returns the magnification factor from native stage device units to micro meters: microMeters = units * unitMagnifier

Returns:
Magnification factor for native stage unit to micro meter conversion.
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
